body:
Are they all .zip files maybe?  I wonder if you have some extension to Windows which is treating these in a special way which confuses rclone.

Can you run this program with the full path to one of those files and send me the output please?

http://pub.rclone.org/stat-windows-386.zip

Eg

```
C> stat.exe "KeePass-2.34-Portable.zip"
```

Thanks

Sure, here is the output from stat.exe, for a failing file:

Name = "KeePass-2.34-Portable.zip"
Size = 2923638
Mode = 0x80001B6
ModTime = 2016-07-26 10:57:08.1369745 -0700 PDT
IsDir = false
Sys = &{1568 {448576140 30533479} {448576140 30533479} {543266961 30533479} 0 2923638}

and for a file that does sync properly:

Name = "ABC.txt"
Size = 1165
Mode = 0x1B6
ModTime = 2013-03-04 11:19:02.0991664 -0800 PST
IsDir = false
Sys = &{32 {687528094 29898661} {1807448354 30390944} {555399344 30284045} 0 1165}

The files that generate Can't transfer non file/directory are a mix of zip and dll files.

Hmm, those mode flags indicate that that zip file is a symlink

Looking at the go source I see

``` go
    if fs.sys.FileAttributes&syscall.FILE_ATTRIBUTE_REPARSE_POINT != 0 {
        m |= ModeSymlink
    }
```

And according to the msdn docs

FILE_ATTRIBUTE_REPARSE_POINT 1024 (0x400): A file or directory that has an associated [reparse point](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa365503%28v=vs.85%29.aspx), or a file that is a symbolic link.

A bit more digging [reveals this](http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/forum/windows_7-performance/what-is-a-reparse-point-can-anyone-reveal-the/17b9b457-6c8a-4e83-a445-e603011a6b95) - the second answer says

> I also use 64-bit Windows 7 and generally love it, but was stumped for awhile with this same backup problem. Apparently reparse points are related to or associated with backup restore points in some manner. I had moved files to a new physical disk and partition I installed recently. Backups of the moved files were failing with the 0x81000037 error. I followed the steps below and was able to get a successful backup.
1. Open Windows Explorer and right click the drive letter where the files are stored that cannot be backed up. Click Properties.
2. From the General tab click "Disk Cleanup".
3. On the Disk Cleanup window, switch to the More Options tab.
4. In the System Restore and Shadow Copies section, click "Clean up..."
5. Click Delete

> This initially made me nervous about possible file deletion, so before testing I made another copy of the files to a different partition - a backup of my backup I guess. However this process apparently only deletes restore point information associated with files on a given partition. Once that was done, backups worked fine.

So you could try that and see if it improves things.

I could also ignore the ModeSymlink on windows which may or may not do the right thing, I'm not sure!

Thanks, based on what you discovered about reparse points; some additional information that may be relevant is that the zip file in question lives on a volume with [Microsoft Server's native volume deduplication](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh769303%28v=vs.85%29.aspx) feature enabled.

The same volume is also protected using Microsoft Shadow Copies. I am not entirely sure how reparse points figure in with shadow copies. But, unlike a locally protected volume, in our case the shadow copy data is stored on another volume entirely and managed by a Microsoft Data Protection Manager (DPM) server.

Unfortunately for us, it is not an option to disable duplication or shadow copies on the volume in question, but I could certainly try using rclone to sync from a more normal volume (no shadow copy protection, no native dedupe) to verify that works as expected.
Synching the same data from another volume without Microsoft's volume deduplication enabled results in no errors.
Interesting! When I get back from vacation I'll send you a build which ignores the junction point and we can see what happens.

issue.title: Access Denied while copying AppData

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)

rclone v1.33

> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

Windows 10 Anniversary Update, 64 bit

> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

Amazon Cloud Drive

> The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

rclone copy --bwlimit=.6M  --max-size=50G --verbose --stats=10s --checkers 16 "C:\Users\wanja" ACDEnc:\Users\wanja

> A log from the command with the `-v` flag (eg output from `rclone -v copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

2016/09/07 08:15:54 Failed to copy: failed to open directory "\\?\C:\Users\wanja\Anwendungsdaten": open \?\C:\Users\wanja\Anwendungsdaten: Access is denied. (Anwendungsdaten is the german name for AppData, the folder is showing up as AppData in the explorer though)

I get the same error even when running rclone as an administrator.

body:
Here is a beta with a potential fix: http://pub.rclone.org/v1.33-8-ga02273e%CE%B2/

Let me know how you get on!

Thanks
Did this work?  (Note to self - this is in the `ingore-junction-points` branch!)

Hi Nick, yes it did work - all files synched from the de-duped volume using
the build you sent me. I think I posted to the original thread. Thanks,
Andrew

On Mon, Sep 19, 2016 at 8:56 AM, Nick Craig-Wood notifications@github.com
wrote:

> Did this work? (Note to self - this is in the ingore-junction-points
> branch!)
> 
> â€”
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/614#issuecomment-248034457, or mute
> the thread
> https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AUBdAU7Tnv0Fo1yiH5-2XBFFSec1a7h1ks5qrrCvgaJpZM4JjSOI
> .
Thanks for checking - I'll merge this to master now

issue.title: Problem with Windows shadowcopy and junctions

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

I have a script which creates a Windows shadowcopy.  I then use rclone to sync the files to Google Drive.  When doing it on my Windows home directory (C:\Users\meow), it has issues as Windows has a bunch of Junctions it needs.

> cd C:\Users\meow
> dir /al

```
05/20/2018  01:05 AM    <JUNCTION>     Application Data [C:\Users\meow\AppData\Roaming]
05/20/2018  01:05 AM    <JUNCTION>     Cookies [C:\Users\meow\AppData\Local\Microsoft\Windows\INetCookies]
05/20/2018  01:05 AM    <JUNCTION>     Local Settings [C:\Users\meow\AppData\Local]
05/20/2018  01:05 AM    <JUNCTION>     My Documents [C:\Users\meow\Documents]
05/20/2018  01:05 AM    <JUNCTION>     NetHood [C:\Users\meow\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Network Shortcuts]
05/20/2018  01:05 AM    <JUNCTION>     PrintHood [C:\Users\meow\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Printer Shortcuts]
05/20/2018  01:05 AM    <JUNCTION>     Recent [C:\Users\meow\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Recent]
05/20/2018  01:05 AM    <JUNCTION>     SendTo [C:\Users\meow\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\SendTo]
05/20/2018  01:05 AM    <JUNCTION>     Start Menu [C:\Users\meow\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu]
05/20/2018  01:05 AM    <JUNCTION>     Templates [C:\Users\meow\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Templates]
```

rclone gets an error on these junctions.


Bash (on Cygwin) Script:
Creates a shadowcopy of C: and D:, then creates a link in C: and D: to the shadowcopy.  Runs rclone on the C: drive shadowcopy (the D: is unused) in the user's home directory.

```
#!/usr/bin/bash
###############################################################################

DATE=`date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S`
UUID=`uuidgen`
LOG="rclone-GoogleDrive.${DATE}.log"
RCLONE="/cygdrive/c/Users/meow/Google Drive/Program Files/rclone/rclone.exe"

###############################################################################

SHADOWID_C=`wmic shadowcopy call create Volume='C:\' | grep ShadowID | awk {'print $NF'} | sed s/[^A-Z0-9\-]//g`
if [ "${SHADOWID_C}" == "" ] || [ "${SHADOWID_D}" == "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000" ]; then
	echo "Failed to create shadow copy." >> ~/logs/${LOG}
	exit
fi
echo "Shadow ID C: ${SHADOWID_C}" >> ~/logs/${LOG}
SHADOWID_D=`wmic shadowcopy call create Volume='D:\' | grep ShadowID | awk {'print $NF'} | sed s/[^A-Z0-9\-]//g`
if [ "${SHADOWID_D}" == "" ] || [ "${SHADOWID_D}" == "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000" ]; then
	echo "Failed to create shadow copy." >> ~/logs/${LOG}
	exit
fi
echo "Shadow ID D: ${SHADOWID_D}" >> ~/logs/${LOG}

SHADOWVOL_C=`vssadmin list shadows /Shadow={${SHADOWID_C}} | grep 'Shadow Copy Volume' | awk {'print $NF'}`
if [ "${SHADOWVOL_C}" == "" ]; then
	echo "Failed to list shadow copy by ID: ${SHADOWID_C}" >> ~/logs/${LOG}
	exit
fi
echo "Shadow Volume C: ${SHADOWVOL_C}" >> ~/logs/${LOG}
SHADOWVOL_D=`vssadmin list shadows /Shadow={${SHADOWID_D}} | grep 'Shadow Copy Volume' | awk {'print $NF'}`
if [ "${SHADOWVOL_D}" == "" ]; then
	echo "Failed to list shadow copy by ID: ${SHADOWID_D}" >> ~/logs/${LOG}
	exit
fi
echo "Shadow Volume D: ${SHADOWVOL_D}" >> ~/logs/${LOG}

cmd /c mklink /D C:\\${UUID} ${SHADOWVOL_C}\\ >& /dev/null
SHADOWDIR_C=/cygdrive/c/${UUID}
SHADOWDIR_CW=C:\\${UUID}
if [ `ls ${SHADOWDIR_C} 2>/dev/null | wc -l` -le 0 ]; then
	echo "Failed to list shadow copy directory: ${SHADOWDIR_C}" >> ~/logs/${LOG}
	exit
fi
echo "Shadow Directory C: ${SHADOWDIR_C}" >> ~/logs/${LOG}
cmd /c mklink /D D:\\${UUID} ${SHADOWVOL_D}\\ >& /dev/null
SHADOWDIR_D=/cygdrive/d/${UUID}
SHADOWDIR_DW=D:\\${UUID}
if [ `ls ${SHADOWDIR_D} 2>/dev/null | wc -l` -le 0 ]; then
	echo "Failed to list shadow copy directory: ${SHADOWDIR_D}" >> ~/logs/${LOG}
	exit
fi
echo "Shadow Directory D: ${SHADOWDIR_D}" >> ~/logs/${LOG}

###############################################################################

"${RCLONE}" sync ${SHADOWDIR_CW}\\Users\\meow GoogleDrive:/meow --exclude-from ${SHADOWDIR_CW}\\Users\\meow\\Google\ Drive\\Cygwin\\home\\meow\\rclone.exclude --skip-links --delete-during --delete-excluded --backup-dir=GoogleDrive:/old/meow/${DATE} --log-file C:\\cygwin64\\tmp\\${LOG} -vv --track-renames --fast-list --local-no-check-updated
cat /tmp/${LOG} >> ~/logs/${LOG}
rm /tmp/${LOG}

###############################################################################

cmd /C rmdir ${SHADOWDIR_CW}
cmd /C rmdir ${SHADOWDIR_DW}

vssadmin delete shadows /Shadow={${SHADOWID_C}} /Quiet >& /dev/null
vssadmin delete shadows /Shadow={${SHADOWID_D}} /Quiet >& /dev/null

```

#### What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)

rclone v1.41
- os/arch: windows/amd64
- go version: go1.10

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

Windows 10 Pro 64-bit
Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.17134.48]

####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

Local  -> Google Drive

#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

> "${RCLONE}" sync ${SHADOWDIR_CW}\\Users\\meow GoogleDrive:/meow --exclude-from ${SHADOWDIR_CW}\\Users\\meow\\Google\ Drive\\Cygwin\\home\\meow\\rclone.exclude --skip-links --delete-during --delete-excluded --backup-dir=GoogleDrive:/old/meow/${DATE} --log-file C:\\cygwin64\\tmp\\${LOG} -vv --track-renames --fast-list --local-no-check-updated


#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
2018/06/03 11:10:38 ERROR : Attempt 1/3 failed with 14 errors and: read \\?\C:\7e551a29-766f-4761-8289-252861cbba09\Users\meow\AppData\Local\Temporary Internet Files: The handle is invalid.
2018/06/03 11:10:38 DEBUG : Application Data: Clearing symlink bit to allow a file with reparse points to be copied
2018/06/03 11:10:38 DEBUG : Cookies: Clearing symlink bit to allow a file with reparse points to be copied
2018/06/03 11:10:38 DEBUG : Local Settings: Clearing symlink bit to allow a file with reparse points to be copied
2018/06/03 11:10:38 DEBUG : My Documents: Clearing symlink bit to allow a file with reparse points to be copied
2018/06/03 11:10:38 DEBUG : NetHood: Clearing symlink bit to allow a file with reparse points to be copied
2018/06/03 11:10:38 DEBUG : PrintHood: Clearing symlink bit to allow a file with reparse points to be copied
2018/06/03 11:10:38 DEBUG : Recent: Clearing symlink bit to allow a file with reparse points to be copied
2018/06/03 11:10:38 DEBUG : SendTo: Clearing symlink bit to allow a file with reparse points to be copied
2018/06/03 11:10:38 DEBUG : Start Menu: Clearing symlink bit to allow a file with reparse points to be copied
2018/06/03 11:10:38 DEBUG : Templates: Clearing symlink bit to allow a file with reparse points to be copied
```

```
2018/06/03 11:10:28 INFO  : Google drive root 'meow': Making map for --track-renames
2018/06/03 11:10:28 INFO  : Google drive root 'meow': Finished making map for --track-renames
2018/06/03 11:10:28 DEBUG : SendTo: Hash failed: hash: failed to read: read \\?\C:\7e551a29-766f-4761-8289-252861cbba09\Users\meow\SendTo: The handle is invalid.
2018/06/03 11:10:28 DEBUG : Cookies: Hash failed: hash: failed to read: read \\?\C:\7e551a29-766f-4761-8289-252861cbba09\Users\meow\Cookies: The handle is invalid.
2018/06/03 11:10:28 DEBUG : NetHood: Hash failed: hash: failed to read: read \\?\C:\7e551a29-766f-4761-8289-252861cbba09\Users\meow\NetHood: The handle is invalid.
2018/06/03 11:10:28 DEBUG : My Documents: Hash failed: hash: failed to open: open \\?\C:\7e551a29-766f-4761-8289-252861cbba09\Users\meow\My Documents: Access is denied.
2018/06/03 11:10:28 DEBUG : Recent: Hash failed: hash: failed to read: read \\?\C:\7e551a29-766f-4761-8289-252861cbba09\Users\meow\Recent: The handle is invalid.

2018/06/03 11:10:28 DEBUG : Start Menu: Hash failed: hash: failed to read: read \\?\C:\7e551a29-766f-4761-8289-252861cbba09\Users\meow\Start Menu: The handle is invalid.
2018/06/03 11:10:28 DEBUG : PrintHood: Hash failed: hash: failed to read: read \\?\C:\7e551a29-766f-4761-8289-252861cbba09\Users\meow\PrintHood: The handle is invalid.
```
